Description: Round-topped limestone stela with detail in black ink: at the top is a winged sun-disc with uraei and a representation of the sky and stars; below is a representation of the deceased adoring Osiris, offering-table in between; at the bottom are seven lines of Hieroglyphic text and four of Demotic(?).
Curator's comments: Translation: Maystre, Les grands pretres de Ptah de Memphis (OBO 113): p.392-393 cf. J. Quaegebeur, Chronique d'Egypte 49 (1974), 66-7 (no. 14).
